CAL for Windows Server 2025.<br> 2. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PROVINCIAL HOSPITAL CENTER OF THE JELENIA GORA VALLEY. Summary: Delivery and Launch of Solutions Enabling Physical Segmentation of Servers and Edge Devices. Description: The subject of the order is the delivery and launch of solutions enabling the physical segmentation of servers for the Provincial Hospital Center of the Jelenia Gora Valley in Jelenia Gora, in accordance with Annex No. 1 to the SWZ - Description of the Subject of the Order. The subject of the order includes design together with the installation, delivery and commissioning of solutions enabling the physical segmentation of servers and edge devices in order to increase the security and efficiency of the network and server infrastructure. The designed solution is intended to provide physical segmentation allowing for isolation critical IT resources, which minimizes the risk of spreading potential cyber threats and limits unauthorized users' access to sensitive data. In order to implement the physical segmentation of servers and edge devices, the Ordering Party allows the preparation of a second one server room in a container building. The final date for completion of deliveries and order fulfillment cannot be later than May 15, 2026.<br> Delivery and launch of solutions enabling physical segmentation of servers<br> and edge devices<br> Doc Title: Delivery and launch of enabling solutions physical segmentation of servers and edge devices<br> Contract Type: supplies. In order to implement the physical segmentation of servers and edge devices, the Ordering Party allows the preparation of a second one server room in a container building. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: SHARED SERVICES CENTER OF THE CITY OF TYCHY. Summary: Providing Optical Fibers for Data Transmission In the Tychy City Commune in 2026-2027. Description: The subject of the order is the provision of fiber optic fibers for data transmission in the Tychy Municipality in 2026 and 2027. The scope of the order includes, among others: provision of services to the Ordering Party consisting in: a) connecting the Ordering Party's network and video devices to the infrastructure the Contractor's fiber-optic network;b) making available the fiber-optic network fibers specified in the SWZ together with passive devices necessary to establish a connection for the purpose of transmitting the Video Monitoring System signal and extending the LAN networks managed by the Ordering Party;c) providing activities maintenance and service to the extent necessary to maintain quality parameters and periodic inspections related to network certification. The order was divided into three tasks. A detailed description of the subject of the order is attached as Appendix No. 4 to SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-11-17. Summary: Conducting Ongoing Maintenance and Repairs of the Measurement System Located on Roads Managed by the Gddkia Branch in Lublin, Along with Providing Data, over a Period of 18 Months.. Description: The subject of the contract is the ongoing maintenance and repairs of the measurement system located on roads managed by GDDKiA Branch in Lublin, including the provision of data, over a period of 18 months. Comprehensive ongoing maintenance of the measurement system includes activities enabling for uninterrupted operation of the system in accordance with OPZ requirements, including the provision of data recorded by the measurement system devices and data exchange with the Ordering Party's Regional Traffic Management System (RSZR). Maintenance activities include, among others: maintenance and continuous maintenance efficiency and proper technical condition of all elements constituting the measurement system, in particular the technical and software infrastructure, collecting recorded data and performing auxiliary activities, i.e. calibration and verification tests ensuring the achievement of required accuracy of data provided by stations. The maintenance of the measurement system also includes ensuring the collection, exchange and transmission of data to and from measurement stations, as well as all activities related to ensuring the proper functioning of individual station modules, including signs and variable message boards constituting part of the measuring station infrastructure. Maintaining the measurement system also includes repairs to the infrastructure and equipment of the measurement system necessary to maintain proper technical condition and ensure continuity deliver.... Educational e-materials will be prepared by other project entities, selected competitively in separate proceedings by someone other than the Center for the Development of Polish Education Abroad ordering party.

As part of the task, the Contractor will: 1) provide access to the service, license, remote installation and launch of agents on computers and servers, configuration of the central console in manufacturer's cloud, integration with AD, launching the EDR/XDR function, as well as introducing rules that automate detection and response to incidents. The entire system will be configured in accordance with the Ordering Party's requirements, taking into account the security policy, 2) it will provide a cloud storage service with a total capacity of 50 TB for the period until June 21, 2026. The service is intended to serve as a secure and scalable data repository for organizations, enabling data storage, backup and recovery.3. A detailed description of the subject of the order is provided in Appendix No. 1 to SWZ.

The devices must be fully compatible with those currently in use the Ordering Party's infrastructure. The ordering party expects a solution enabling the replacement of current Cisco ASA 5516 devices with a new generation of devices ensuring current integration, exchange of security metadata and high availability of the architecture (High Availability). The solution provided must complement the current solution FortiGate devices used, allowing for diversification and reducing the risk of vendor lock-in. All hardware and software supplied must be covered by a 36-month manufacturer's warranty and manufacturer's technical support (or equivalent), including updates, access to the manufacturer's portal and the ability to direct extinguishing of failures.2. According to the scope of the delivery of technical infrastructure (IT) for the University of Gdańsk and GOPS planned under the Grant, the order in question was divided into three parts: Part I of the order entitled Infrastructure delivery server and network along with equipment for the Commune Office in Lubin includes the supply of: 1) hardware server - 1 piece, 2) disk array 1 piece, 3) A network switches 3 pieces, 4) B network switches 2 pieces. The CSOB system is a key element of the IT infrastructure the Ordering Party, supporting the processing of applications for financial assistance under the Strategic Plan of the Common Agricultural Policy for 2023-2027 (hereinafter referred to as PS 23-27). This system was designed as a central platform for managing processes related to granting and settling support for beneficiaries, in exchange for the Remuneration specified in the Agreement.<br> These currently include:<br> 1.1.1. Electronic Services Platform (PUE) - CSOB cooperates with PUE, enabling beneficiaries to submit applications and maintaining correspondence with ARiMR in electronic form. Financial and Accounting System (EBS) Integration with EBS allows automatic transfer of financial data, which streamlines processes accounting related to the payment of funds to beneficiaries;<br> 1.1.3. Producer Register - CSOB uses reference data contained in the Entity Register, which ensures consistency of information about beneficiaries in various ARiMR systems;<br> 1.1.4. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: SOCIAL INSURANCE INSTITUTION. Summary: Purchase of Software to Monitor the Applications and Infrastructure of the Pue/Ezus Portal Along with Support. Description: I. The subject of the order is:<br> 1. delivery of a 48-month subscription for Software for monitoring the applications and infrastructure of the PUE/eZUS Portal (hereinafter: Software) in accordance with the requirements specified in Chapter II of Annex No. 7 to the SWZ,<br> 2. implementation of the delivered Software on all infrastructure elements indicated by ZUS - indicated in Table 1 - in accordance with the requirements specified in Chapter III of Annex No. 7 to the SWZ,<br> 3. providing Software maintenance services in accordance with the requirements specified in Chapter IV of Annex No. 7 to the SWZ,<br> 4. conducting workshops for administrators up to 240 man-hours in accordance with the requirements specified in Chapter V of Annex No. 7 to the SWZ. The Ordering Party guarantees the order to conduct workshops of min. 160 man-hours.<br> II. Order completion date:<br> 1. delivery and implementation of the Software will take place in within 60 days from the date of conclusion of the Agreement, but not earlier than January 1, 2026, provided that:<br> the technical design and draft schedule will be submitted for collection by the Ordering Party within 15 days from the date of conclusion of the Agreement;<br> documents indicated in point 1.1. will be subject to approval by the Ordering Party within 30 days from the date of conclusion of the Agreement;<br> 2. workshops for administrators will be conducted until the end of the Agreement;<br> 3. subscriptions for the Software (use of the Software) - 48 months from the start of work implementation.... Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PRZEDSIĘBIORSTWO MUNICIPAL SPOŁKA Z OGRANICZONĄ ODPOWIEDZIALNOŚCIĄ. Summary: "Digitization of the Process of Reading, Recording and Settling Water Consumption and Establishing an Electronic Service Office for Siemiatycze Residents in the Field of Water and Sewage Management" Part I. Description: 1. The subject of the order is financed by the European Funds for Podlaskie Program 2021-2027, Priority FEPK.01 Competitive and Digital Economy, Measure FEPK.01.02 Digitization.<br> 2. The order includes the delivery and implementation of a stationary water meter reading system based on radio transmission, along with the delivery of the necessary software, granting a software license, system launch and integration with the ZSI billing module. The provided system is intended to standardize and improve the process of reading water meters and introduce the process of calculating fees for consumed water. and discharged sewage on a monthly basis for all recipients. The implementation of the system will reduce the need to enter the recipient's property each time to read the water meter level, which will reduce errors caused by the human factor. The stationary water meter reading system will allow to generate water consumption charts and detect leaks at customers.<br> 3. Scope of the order:<br> 1) delivery of 2,946 radio overlays for water meters along with the necessary infrastructure for data transmission;<br> 2) installation of 2,946 radio overlays for water meters along with the necessary infrastructure for data transmission;<br> 3) license for a stationary water meter reading system.<br> 4. A detailed description of the subject of the order along with the minimum requirements is presented in Annex No. 2 to the SWZ - Detailed Description of the Subject of the Order (SOPZ).<br> "Digitization of the process of reading, recording and settling consumption water<br> oh.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Open Market Consultation (Omc) for a Future Precommercial Procurement (Pcp) for the R&D (Research & Development) Services on Ict Tools for Energy Monitoring and Management. Description: A PIN announces the OMC of a future PCP for the development of ICT tools for energy monitoring and management. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best valueformoney solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a riskbenefit sharing under market conditions between the public procurer and the suppliers, and a clear separation between the PCP and the deployment of commercial volumes of endproducts. PCP procurement is exempted from the WTO Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), the EU public procurement directives and the national laws that implement them. Overall, the OMC aims to: (1) Validate the findings of the preliminary stateofthe art analysis and the viability of the set of technical and financial provisions. (2) Raise awareness of the industry and relevant stakeholders regarding the potential future PCP. (3) Collect insights from the industry and relevant stakeholders to finetune the tender specifications and publish a more qualitative tender. All OMC activities, including surveys, the Q&A document, webinars (dates and content) as well as registration information will be published for transparency purposes (Ogłoszenie o konsultacjach rynkowych dotyczących wyzwań badawczych z obszaru .... Published Date: 2025-10-30. Closing Date: 2025-12-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: BORDER GUARD HEADQUARTERS. Summary: Development and Maintenance of Classified and Cybersecurity Systems - Ssl/Tls Traffic Detection and Distribution Service. Description: The subject of the order is the provision of SSL/TLS traffic detection and distribution services using a solution in the form of an SSL/TLS traffic decryption system with hardware acceleration allowing data encryption/decryption at a speed of min. 35Gbps. As part of the provision of the service, the Ordering Party requires the provision of technical support aimed at its uninterrupted operation for a period of 36 months from the date of signing the Service Launch Protocol. Technical and service support must be provided at the point of use of the system and devices.<br> The Ordering Party may invalidate the said contracts procedure if the public funds that the Ordering Party intended to allocate to finance all or part of the contract are not awarded to it, and the possibility of invalidating the procedure on this basis was provided for in the contract notice (Article 257 of the Public Procurement Act).<br> I would like to inform you that on pursuant to art. 24 section 1 and art. 33 of the Act of June 14, 2024 on the protection of whistleblowers (Journal of Laws, item 928), the "Internal procedure for reporting violations of the law and taking follow-up actions at the Border Guard Headquarters" was introduced at the Border Guard Headquarters, and "Procedure for accepting external reports and taking follow-up actions at the Border Guard Headquarters."<br> Detailed information can be accessed at the following address:<br> https://bip.kgsg.strazgraniczna.pl/s01/zgloczenia-o-naruszenie-prawa/21896,Regulacje-prawne-i-organizac.... Published Date: 2025-10-30. Closing Date: 2025-12-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PKP POLSKIE LINIE KOLEJOWE S.A.. Summary: Construction of a Central Dynamic Passenger Information System (Csdip), Video Monitoring System (Smw) and Reconstruction of Passenger Lifts at Skierniewice Station, Implemented as Part of the Project..... Description: CONSTRUCTION OF A CENTRAL DYNAMIC PASSENGER INFORMATION SYSTEM (CSDIP), VIDEO MONITORING SYSTEM (SMW) AND RECONSTRUCTION OF PASSENGER LIFTS AT SKIERNIEWICE STATION, IMPLEMENTED AS PART OF THE PROJECT....<br> CONSTRUCTION OF A CENTRAL DYNAMIC PASSENGER INFORMATION SYSTEM (CSDIP) AND MONITORING SYSTEM WIZYJOWY (SMW) AND RECONSTRUCTION OF PASSENGER LIFTS AT SKIERNIEWICE STATION" IMPLEMENTED AS PART OF THE PROJECT RECONSTRUCTION OF TRAVEL SERVICE INFRASTRUCTURE AT STATIONS AND STOPS (8.009)<br> The subject of the order is the design, delivery and installation of elements of the central dynamic system passenger information and a video monitoring system along with technical and telecommunications infrastructure, as well as the design and construction of elevator shafts with passenger elevators adapted to the requirements of TSI PRM at the Skierniewice station. The subject of the order included the renewal of technical support, service support and the right to update subscriptions for new generation firewalls and the firewall management system owned by the Border Guard for a period of 24 months. Owned by the Ordering Party the infrastructure is based on Palo Alto firewalls and it is currently necessary to extend the subscription and support for these devices in order to maintain them in technical condition allowing for trouble-free use in the Border Guard systems and to ensure cyber protection of the Guard's infrastructure Graniczna. Technical and service support for firewalls and the firewall management system will include, among others: material and construction defects, repair of detected damage, access to patches and updates, and a list of security alarms. Subscription technical support will be provided include, among others: updates, online technical support, product improvements and updates, and support in their use.<br> The product numbers covered by the order are: a) PAN-PA-220-ATP-R (Threat prevention subscription renewal, PA-220) for 174 devices; b) PAN-SVC-BKLN-220-R (Partner enabled premium support renewal, PA-220) for 174 devices; c) PAN-PA-850-ATP-R (Threat prevention subscription renewal, PA-850) for 10 devices; d) PAN-SVC-BKLN-850-R (Partner enabled premium support r...

The Contractor is obliged to deliver equipment that is brand new, unused and not exhibited at exhibitions or fairs, technically efficient, free from legal and physical defects, safe, complete and ready for use. work covered by the subject of the contract - in accordance with OPZ.<br> 5.
